author.name: TfT Hacker - Exploring Tools for Thought and PKM
author.description: Exploring Tools for Thought space and PKM, with focus on tools like Obsidian, Tana, Craft, LogSeq, RemNote, AthensResearch, OneNote, etc https://t.co/GyMiAikIl1

html: It has always been possible to search for all references to a node in @tana_inc, or all node where for example Author:: John Grisham. In the last release, we added some functionality to make it even easier to create these searches. https://t.co/oJ4Pb4q7Uc https://t.co/hnmtQjPcWe

author.name: Graph Commons
author.description: Collaborative platform for mapping, analyzing, publishing data-networks. Email/PGP public key: https://t.co/WS1YOJsTcR

html: 🛠 Existing users' credentials are migrated, you just need to import your graphs, that's only a couple of clicks! Legacy version will be maintained until the end of this year. Your embedded graphs will work via redirection until that date.\n8/9

author.name: Graph Commons
author.description: Collaborative platform for mapping, analyzing, publishing data-networks. Email/PGP public key: https://t.co/WS1YOJsTcR

html: Thank you for being a part of Graph Commons' journey and helping shape the platform into what it is today. Join us in our chat channel for your questions or comments. We are looking forward to your feedback and to the impact that you are creating through Graph Commons.\n9/9

author.name: Graph Commons
author.description: Collaborative platform for mapping, analyzing, publishing data-networks. Email/PGP public key: https://t.co/WS1YOJsTcR

html: 🦾 The new Graph Commons does not just come with a snappy UI and a fresh look, but also a robust infrastructure, and an easy to use GraphQL API (more on this later).\n6/9

author.name: Graph Commons
author.description: Collaborative platform for mapping, analyzing, publishing data-networks. Email/PGP public key: https://t.co/WS1YOJsTcR

html: 🔍 Search is faster and more powerful. 1) Search in-graph and pinpoint nodes and relationships in a complex network. 2) Search the diverse graphs created by the contribution of thousands of users in the Graph Common platform. https://t.co/x4vlnS15DC\n5/9 https://t.co/57TCizrdis

author.name: Graph Commons
author.description: Collaborative platform for mapping, analyzing, publishing data-networks. Email/PGP public key: https://t.co/WS1YOJsTcR

html: 🤝 Each graph is a shared workspace. Just invite colleagues and collaborate around data-networks.\n4/9 https://t.co/AezSYV1LXc

author.name: Graph Commons
author.description: Collaborative platform for mapping, analyzing, publishing data-networks. Email/PGP public key: https://t.co/WS1YOJsTcR

html: ✨It is now easier to generate insight about your networks using core metrics: Find organic clusters and bridging actors, the most central and peripheral nodes, and similarities based on common relationships.\n\nMore about analyzing networks in our docs: https://t.co/wJWe5jE5yQ 3/9 https://t.co/j4cUBq9vly

author.name: Graph Commons
author.description: Collaborative platform for mapping, analyzing, publishing data-networks. Email/PGP public key: https://t.co/WS1YOJsTcR

html: 🕸 The graph making experience has improved from data imports to management, from customized graph visualizations to navigation.\n2/9 https://t.co/tIQQsKsfyT

author.name: Graph Commons
author.description: Collaborative platform for mapping, analyzing, publishing data-networks. Email/PGP public key: https://t.co/WS1YOJsTcR

html: The new Graph Commons is here! https://t.co/lvm4xBwlFg\n\nThere are a lot of new features and improvements. We can't wait to see how you'll use them to gain better insights and create deeper impact. 1/9 🧵 https://t.co/2Etsb6t3B4

author.name: Veronika Heimsbakk
author.description: I enjoy semantic technologies, LaTeX and teaching kids to code. Mother of two. Maker. Huntress. Boardgame and whisky nerd. veronahe@mas.to

html: I am writing a talk on digital twins from a knowledge graph perspective. If anyone has experiences or thoughts to share with me. Feel free!

html: I am writing a talk on digital twins from a knowledge graph perspective. If anyone has experiences or thoughts to share with me. Feel free!
